intro: Prionachne, commonly known as the grass genus, is a group of flowering plants belonging to the Poaceae family. These plants are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in wet or marshy environments. Prionachne species are characterized by their slender, grass-like appearance with narrow leaves and spikelet-based inflorescences. They play an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife. Due to their ecological significance, some species are also used in restoration projects and ornamental gardening.
